title: Lady Dai and David vases-shared imagery

content.question: The funeral banner of Lady Dai and the David Vases are similar in that both

choices.label: were created for display in Buddhist temples
use costly pigments imported from the Middle East
include stylized dragon motifs as symbols of power
were recovered from ancient royal tombs

content.answer: include stylized dragon motifs as symbols of power

unit.text: 8: South, East, and Southeast Asia, 300 BCE - 1980 CE

topic.text: 8.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in South, East, and Southeast Asian Art

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe similarities and/or differences in two or more works of art using appropriate and relevant points of comparison.
